t: Job 12
And*p Job answered and said,
No*p doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
But*p I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
I*p am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.
He*p that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
The*p tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
But*p ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
Or*p speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
Who*p knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord*s hath wrought this?
In*p whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
Doth*p not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
With*p the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
With*p him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
Behold,*p he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
Behold,*p he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
With*p him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
He*p leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
He*p looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
He*p leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
He*p removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
He*p poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
He*p discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
He*p increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
He*p taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
They*p grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
